Key: *Yawn*... Morning.
Morning, Onii-chan!
Morning, Shido. You sure look sleepy.
Shido. Good morning. Breakfast is ready.
Oh, thank you. Sorry for leaving it all to you guys.
It's not a big deal. I'm just doing what I enjoy.

Yes, likewise. However, Shido... You should think
about the days that Rinne and I won't be here and
wake up a bit earlier.
Yeah, if that happens, breakfast would be lunch～
Oh, you're right... Sorry.

We're not scolding you. We just want you to be a little
more responsible.
*Grunt*... Okay.

(It's true. Since they were always here, I've started
to become complacent. I have no rebuttal.)
Hahaha, Maria-chan... That was a bit hard on Shido.
That's fine. It's important that he knows.

Gosh, Maria-chan... Anyways Shido, if you just stand
there, your breakfast will get cold.
Ah, sorry! Thanks!
(I tried to play off my discomfort and sat down.)

Man, I'm so excited. We're having a cooking class at
Rinne-onechan's place.
A cooking class?

Remember how Tohka-chan said she wanted me to
teach her how to cook? So I've been visiting her
whenever I have some spare time.

Ah, Maria did tell me about it, but... Wow, a cooking
class?

Hahaha. It's not that big of a deal. Tobiichi-san and
Tokisaki-san said that they wanted to join, too...
So then we figured it'd be fun if we all got together.
Ah... I see.

(Then that means almost everyone's gathered there,
huh? If she's taking care of all of them, that's
pretty tough.)

Oh, don't worry though. We plan on finishing up by
the evening. I'll be making dinner for you.

No, don't worry about me, okay? I can do things on
my own, and worst-case scenario, I can just eat out.
That's right, Rinne. And he has me as well.

Uh-uh. Yesterday I left him all to you, Maria-chan,
so I'm going to ask you to take care of lunch instead,
and I'll do dinner. Okay?
If that's what you want to do, Rinne, I'll respect it.
Thank you, Maria-chan.

Seems like not only is Rinne an older sister, but
Maria's becoming one too. I'm getting more big
sisters!
When you say that, I feel like we'll get even more...
(They're not toys.)

Why are you looking like that? I'm only kidding, gosh.
The only time I'll get a new sister is when you get
married.

Well, that's true but... Marriage. It's such a long
while away.

Who knows. ...Well, I'll never allow you to marry, so
I'll never get a real sister until the end of time.
Hm? Did you say anything?
No, nothing.

Anyways Onii-chan, you're off today. What are you
going to do?

Uh... I'm going to go shopping. I'll head into town
and check some things out.
Okay, okay. Got it.
Do your best to learn from Rinne, okay?

Hehehe. Don't underestimate me! Just give me a day,
and I'll surpass you.
I-I don't think you can pull that off...

I know. Even if it's you, Kotori, it's not something
you can figure out in a day or two.
Haha... Yeah.
Gosh, you guys suck!
Hahaha...
Hehehe...

(Rinne's and Maria's laughter echoed through the
living room. Why did I find that so dear? As the
thought came to mind, my smile almost faded.)
Well, I have to get ready.
(I tried to brush it off, and returned to my room.)
Shido...
Rio and Marina... They're still not here.
Morning, Papa!
Morning Rio. Where's Marina?
Marina? She's not here.

Not here... Oh come to think of it, you did say she
only comes out after dark...

Marina is Rio's guardian. She'll be with me when it's
dangerous.

(I don't know why, but it seems like Marina can only
come out at night. I guess we can't do anything about
that.)
Then that means it's just you and me, huh?
No? One more person, right?
One more person? It's only Rio and me...
Right, Maria-chan?
...Maria?
...So you've noticed me.
Maria... Why?

Sorry Shido. I was curious about you, so... I wasn't
planning on getting caught.
What do you mean by that?
Exactly what it means.
Oh, come on...

(Maria always had a tendency of following people, so
I guess I would have eventually gotten caught.)

(But it seemed like Maria caught on yesterday. Maybe
she sensed Marina since she's like a sibling to her.)

This will be my first time meeting you, Rio. I'm Maria
Arusu.

Yeah! Nice to meet you! But it doesn't feel like the
first time, huh?

Is that so? That's nice of you. To have an adorable
girl like you say that sure is nice.
Adorable? Rio's adorable?
Yes, very. To the point where I want to hug you.
Thank you, Maria-onechan.

Not at all. I just spoke the truth. But it kind of tickles
to have you call me One-chan.

You don't know? You can call anyone like a sister
One-chan.
*giggle*... I see. You have a point there.

(As she said that, Maria patted Rio's head. It seemed
so familiar―)
Hey, Maria. Don't tell me you...

I was listening to your conversation earlier. So,
Marina is taking care of her, right?
Yeah, that's right. Then she...
Yes I know. But we'll save that for later.

(Maria looked me in the eye, and it seemed like she
didn't want me to say any more. She's right. Rio
shouldn't hear things she doesn't need to.)
Anyways, Rio. Where do you plan on going with Shido?

Where am I going with, Papa? Lots of places. We're
looking for the most important thing!
The most important thing, huh?
Yeah. Rio is supposed to look for it.
I see. So, does it have a shape?
Hm... I don't know. But if I find it, I think I'll know.
That sure seems vague... May I help?

Really?! If you can help me, One-chan, Rio will be
really happy! You too, right Papa?
Yeah, that'd make me happy.

(And besides... if Rio's with us, I may be able to
have Maria and Marina meet.)

(Maybe in this world, I can reunite the two who
would've otherwise never been able to see one
another again. Well... Marina might be shy about it.)
Well, then it'll be the three of us!

(Rio happily held Maria's hand. Despite their meeting
for the first time, it seems like she's already fond
of her. Maybe she's sensing Marina in Maria.)
Sure. Let's find what you're looking for.

(I couldn't add to what Maria said. I still didn't
know if I could let Rio find it.)

"(But even so, we set off to look for "the most
important thing". There were no hints to speak of, so
all we could do was walk around town.)"
Papa, do you think it'll be in this store?

Hey, Rio... Is what you're looking for something we
can buy?
Hmm... maybe? It could be, it might not be.

So you don't know, huh? I thought you might know
where to start looking.

I'm just following it. I'm looking a lot, but I don't
see it anywhere.

So we have no choice but to look where Rio thinks...
In that case, this will be very difficult.
...Sure will be.

"(I gave a wry smile but... I was relieved deep inside
If Rio had said, "It looks like a key," then I.
wouldn't have known what to say.)"

(If I were really going to help Rio with her search,
it would be quicker to start by showing her the spare
key. But I couldn't bring myself to do it.)

(I had no basis for it, but... I felt like if I did that,
we'd get to a place where there was no turning back.
That feeling took over my body.)
U-Um, that store... I feel something strong.

A toy store. There's a big rabbit plush doll displayed
on the show window.
You wanna try going in?
Yeah, I'm curious about what's inside!
Rio, please don't pull on me. I'll go with you.
...It seems like she just wants to go in.

(Well, Rio is a child, so it's only natural that she's
interested in toys. I can understand why she'd give
an excuse to go inside. Kotori did the same thing.)
Wow, this is amazing. It looks like a real phone!

Toy manufacturers seem to be creating toys with
multiple functions these days. This one has online
data updates and pairs with game consoles, too.
Is this guitar a toy, too? Can you really play it?

You're right. It seems to be a pretend item. It seems
like the accessory that comes with it is synced with
the game console.

If you change the accessory, you can change the
song, too! Here I go, kira-kira-live!

No, Rio. Although it's a display, you can't play with
the store items.
I'm sorry, Maria-onechan. I'll be careful.
Yes, please do so.
You two look like you're having fun.

(Rio must be happy to be with Maria. I'm sure it's
hard to go inside stores with Marina.)

Rio saw this on the TV. You're supposed to stack them
and make them stronger, and then you go "BAM!
right?"

That's called a trading card game. There are various
types of cards that you can gather and use to battle
with your friends.
I see. Then... that's it! Let's do this!
O-Okay... But only once, okay? My turn. Draw!
Well, I can't just leave them like this, can I?
(I ran after the two and entered the toy store.)
...*sigh*. This is just us playing.

(After the toy store, we went to the book store,
then the flower shop, then a stationery store. We
still couldn't find what we were looking for.)
Hey, Rio isn't playing! I'm looking.

That's right, Shido. Seeing Rio this adorable, it's
wrong to complain.

What Rio said made sense, but I don't know about
you... Maria!

I'm only kidding. But Rio looked like she was having
so much fun. I think that's all that matters.

I guess you have a point... But we shouldn't lose
sight of our goal.
Hehe... You wouldn't fall for it, huh?
Yeah... Not this time.

Yeah, Maria-onechan. You have to say something
that makes more sense, or else Papa won't fall for it.
Can you not casually say such a scary thing?!
Hehehe... Papa, you're funny.

Yes. Shido is funny. I never get tired of watching
him.
Yeah, I totally get it! Papa is amazing.

Hahaha. Yeah, right? That somehow doesn't sound like
a compliment.

(Well, we had a goal in the beginning, but now... I
guess the right thing to do would be to just enjoy
spending time together like this.)

(There were so many unknowns, like what kind of
existence Rio was. But I know it's better to just
smile.)

(Especially if this is a world with a time limit, and
these imaginary days are numbered... I know there's
still value to the time we spend here.)
Papa, that's a place where we can eat, right?

Yeah, that's a family restaurant. It's a bit after lunch
time, huh?
Yeah, I wanna go!

(We spent so much time in all the stores, it was
getting pretty late. It was a bit too late for lunch.)

Then let's go. Judging from the outside, there seem
to be open seats.
You can tell?

I remember that place. And besides, I doubt there
would be any obstacles for Rio in this world.
You have a point...

(If Rio is controlling Eden, then things should go
exactly as we plan.)
(Hm... But did I tell Maria that much?)

Hey, Papa. You need to hurry, or the seats will get
taken!
Oh, Rio, don't yank me...!

So much food. What should I order? Hmm... This...
No... Or this one? Um... Uh... Uh... What do I pick...

You can choose anything you want, so it's fine.
Take your time.
Okay! Thanks, Maria-onechan!

(Rio flipped through the pages and went back and
forth, looking like she was having fun choosing.)

Hmm... Rio wants to order so many things. I can't
choose one.

Then please choose Shido's and my order, too.
Then you'll be able to choose up to three.

She's right. Why don't you start off with that? We'll
come again to try out the others.

Again? Okay... You're right! Then... This, this... and this.
Papa, One-chan, are you okay with this?
Yeah, sure. I'm fine with anything you like, Rio.

A Hamburg steak combo, omurice, and spaghetti with
meat sauce. I'm worried about how much Rio can eat...
Well, I'm sure we can manage. Let's order.
Rio wants to order. Please?

Sure. It's important to try anything. But if you get
it wrong, it won't be good, so you do your best okay?

Not good if I get it wrong...! Okay... got it. Rio
will do her best.

(Rio timidly pushed the button, and she looked so
nervous that it was adorable.)
Phew. I'm full.

(After we left the restaurant, Rio looked satisfied.
I think two hours had passed since we sat down.
The sun was already setting.)
Rio, you ate so much. I'm proud of you.
Hehe. Is Rio a good girl?
Yeah, you are. Good girl.
*Yawn*

I was so surprised to see you finish the whole
omurice. And you even ate cake and pudding for
dessert...
One-chan, sweet things go in another stomach.

You must like sweet things. Is that why you like Shido
too?
Hey Maria, what's that supposed to mean...

I mean exactly what I said. Shido, you're sweet to
girls.
I can't deny that...

I don't get it. Rio loves Papa. Do you not love Papa,
Maria-onechan?
No, I love Shido too.
Hey, wait Maria. Not here.
But it's the truth. And is that a surprise to you?
Well, you have a point but...

(But it's a day off and we're in town. Who knows if
we might bump into people we know―especially
those from school.)

If you have a problem with the location, then we can
go home or to the park.

Well, that's not what I meant... But we did look all
around this area. The sun's setting already, so we
should call it a day.

(And it may be time for Marina to come out. Then I can
have Maria and Marina meet.)
Okay got it. Then let's go to the park!
H-Hey, Rio! Don't run, it's dangerous!
It's just to there, so it's okay!
That kid...
Hehe... Shido, you're starting to act like a father.

You could at least say brother. Now... Hey, wait! Rio!
I'm going to go home now!
No!!! You're a meanie, Papa!

Then you just stand there! You hear me?! Hey, Maria.
Sorry, I know you just ate, but let's go.

Okay, let's go. We can't leave your precious family
alone.

(Rio would suddenly run and then stop, then run and
then stop, staying just ahead of us so we wouldn't
catch up.)

(It's fine that we're running after her, but both
Maria and I were thrown off by Rio's pace.)
*Pant, pant*... Don't make us run after we eat, Rio...
Hehe. But we're playing chase. That was fun!
...Well, I'm glad you had fun.

(That was a workout... Well, the park feels pretty nice.
The weather's nice and the wind is blowing.)
...Hey, Papa. Do you not like it here?
Rio...?

(I don't know how I knew, but I realized that when Rio
said "here", she didn't mean the park.)

Rio loves it here. I mean, I can see you, Papa. And
Marina. And... everyone is smiling.

(I know. I know that. Everyone's here. There's so
much happiness in this world.)
Well...

(Things that disappeared came back. I didn't know
anymore... whether what I thought was right was
actually right...)
...Hey, Rio. I―
Hmmm... hmmm...
Wh-What's the matter, Rio?
I'm getting a little sleepy...
Shido, please bring Rio here.
Okay, Rio. Here.

She must be sleepy because she's full. Hehe. She's
so adorable, look at her sleeping.

We have walked everywhere since this morning, plus
she was just running... I'm not surprised that she's
tired.

You're probably right. And besides, I do hear it's
important to make children take naps.

(Maria gently ran her fingers through Rio's hair. They
looked so sweet. But at the same time, this was a
scene that couldn't happen in reality.)

Shido... Now that Rio's sleeping, can I ask you one
thing?
Hm? What is it?

"Shido... I think you already realize what that "the
most important thing" is, don't you?"
Thanks Shido... I'll take good care of this.
I knew it...
No, Maria, it's not like that... I, um...

Shido, you're a kind person. You're probably thinking
about someone else again... You don't want to hurt
someone, and you're hurting too, aren't you?

No, it's not that! That's not it... It's not something
that nice... I... I just...

(I couldn't put it into words. Rinne, Maria, Marina...
and Rio. There were too many... too many people I
didn't want to lose.)
...Sorry, I can't really put it into words.
...I don't want to give up.
...Sorry, I can't really put it into words.
...I don't want to give up.

I see. But I believe in you. I know that you'll pick
the right answer.

The right answer... Is there such a thing? I don't
know what that is.

Even so, I know you'll choose it at the end. That's
how you've been saving people all these time. Like...
you did with me.
Maria...

(Ever since I found out about the Spirits, I've made
a lot of decisions. I don't know whether they were
right. Maybe there were a bunch of mistakes.)

You might stress about it. You might think you're not
ready. But Shido, you've always made the right
decisions. I guarantee that.
...Maria. Can you read my heart?

I don't think so. However, I have been watching you,
Shido.
I see...

You're always working so hard for other people.
That's why everyone likes you so much.

So I'm going to represent everyone and promise...
No matter what you choose, I'll believe that it was
the right decision. I have faith in you.
...Thanks, Maria.
You're welcome. That's what a good wife does.

A good wife? You know... Well, thanks. I feel a lot
lighter now.
Yes, I am your Maria, Shido.

(And I couldn't help but smile with her. We did this
recently, but it feels so far away.)
Mm...mmm...
Morning, Papa. Maria-onechan.
Good morning, Rio. You slept well.
Good morning. You feel better now?
Yeah, I'm not sleepy anymore.

Okay then, Marina might come any minute now.
The sun's setting.
Yeah, it's evening. It seems dark over there.

(Rio pointed toward the sky. It's true. The sky was
like an orange gradient.)
Hey, Papa. It's almost time...
Time? Time for what?

(I looked around, and Maria was sitting on the swing
alone.)
It's time. Marina.
...Marina? No, Rio. That's Maria there―
But I'm not wrong...

Gosh, you really do put us in a bind. You should
have left Shido Itsuka a long time ago.
I messed up.

Aw, when you say that with a smile, it's not fair.
Anyways, Shido Itsuka... Do I have something on my
face?

Wait, but... Aren't you Maria? Your clothes are the
same...

I guess I'll tell you everything. So Rio, you go play
over there.
Okay, I'll wait for you.
So, where should I start? Any questions?
Questions... I mean, where did Maria go?

...Ah, from there huh? In this world, I am Marina and
Maria. Do you understand?

(Maria is gone and Marina appeared. Considering the
circumstances...)
So... you guys are two in one?

Correct. I disappeared that time. But I left a present
in the end. You know what that is, right?
Maria's data...

Yeah. And inside there, I guess there was a little bit
of my data mixed in. So a small hint of black mixed
into white.
Th-Then, will we be able to resurrect your data?

That's impossible. Not with Marina Arusu now.
It's like a ghost. A faint shadow that will disappear
some day.

My body couldn't come back, even in this Eden.
Maria was able to be resurrected, but I'm so small
that I need Maria's body or I can't move about freely.
Marina... Are you okay with that?

What do you mean? What choice do I have? This is
my final destination. There's nothing... beyond this
point.
That's... That's just too sad!

Don't say that to me. I know myself. I have a role as
Rio Sonogami's―Eden's guardian. So I can exist like
this.

...Eden's guardian? Kind of like the Angel that
appeared the last time?

That's right. I listen to Rio and I help her. That's
my role. Although I'm not forced to do so. And I can
cut through space and freely move to where Rio is.

So that's why you were able to get to Rio before me?
So you guys really are sharing bodies.

Yes. I feel bad that I'm causing Maria problems. But
Maria knows that I'm using her body.
So she's conscious now?

She's awake, but kind of asleep. It's similar to when
Maria's out. Like I said... We're kind of mixed.

I'm currently replicated from Maria so that might have
something to do with it. I'm currently Marina Arusu,
but not the same Marina Arusu that battled you before.
So don't worry about me.
Marina!

I won't go back to the original world, and even if I'm
in Eden, I'll eventually completely melt inside
Maria... and disappear.
Are you okay with that...?! I can't just accept it!

I disappeared once. So, Shido Itsuka... You should
look more toward the future.
The future...?

Just like before, you should get out of these endless
days, and live in the world where you should be. And
be happy there. Isn't such a future awesome?

(I understand where Marina's coming from. But she's
saying to just forget everything and live.)

(It means abandoning Rinne, Marina, and Rio... It
means that kind of future.)
I think you're right.
Everything isn't always about being right.

What you're saying is right, Marina. I do feel like we
should get out of here.

Hehe... If you were still contemplating, that would be
my recommendation. Humans forget what they don't
need to remember. So, that chance has come for you.
That may be true...
I think everything isn't always about being right.
Is that your answer?

I still don't know. But to have you guys disappear and
for everything to end... I just can't accept that.
I see. You're too nice at times like these.

(Marina's smile in the sunset was so beautiful, yet
fleeting. It was loving.)

(Is that beauty going to flutter away? No, that can't
be true. I've discovered it for the first time. Marina
Arusu is a girl who can smile like this.)

Right, so we're done talking here. Someone's waiting
for you, so you should go home now.
No. Will you two come with me?

What? Can you stop with that? Rio and I have things
to do.
...But we don't have much time, right?
I know, but... That's more of a reason―
Shouldn't we have her meet Rinne?
Hey, Rio! You want to see Mama?

Mama?! Hey Papa, I can see Mama? Marina said if I
see her, it won't be good.
No. Papa will allow it.
Hey, Shido! But what if something happens?

Well even if it did, it's better than not seeing one
another at all. Right, Rio?
Yeah! Rio wants to talk to Mama!

...You got me. Fine, I guess! Ugh. Gosh, what is up
with you and your sudden ideas and your actions
and making things happen...

That's my personality. Sorry Marina, you're going to
have to do this with me.

I guess there's no point in my just standing here.
Only today, though. If something happens to Rio,
then we'll leave immediately. Got it?
Yeah, thanks.
Hmph... Gosh, you're so stubborn.

(I still haven't found my answer yet. But I don't want
it to just end like this. So I'm going to do what I
can now.)

(Until the very last moment, I want to have these
smiles last even one second longer.)
